clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Focused Lung Ultrasound in Patients Suspected of COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Focused Lung Ultrasound in Patients Suspected of COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock:
COVID is a major health problem causing massive capacity problems at hospitals. Rapid and
      accurate diagnostic workflow is of paramount importance. Access to radiological diagnostics
      tools such as x-ray or computed tomography of the chest are limited even in high-resource
      settings.

      Focused lung ultrasound, FLUS, is a point-of-care diagnostic tool that allows rapid and
      on-site assessment of lung abnormalities. No transportation of the patient is required thus
      lowering risk of spreading SAR-CoV- inside the hospital.

      This study aims to explore the diagnostic value of FLUS in the COVID-19 pandemic and to
      explore if FLUS findings can predict risk of respiratory failure.

primary_outcome.description: Analysis of FLUS related to risk of development of respiratory failure.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of FLUS related to risk of result of chest x-ray

secondary_outcome.measure: FLUS findings and admission to intensive care.
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of FLUS related to risk of intensive care admission

secondary_outcome.measure: FLUS findings and SAR-CoV-2 PCR-test result.
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of FLUS related to result from SAR-CoV-2 PCR-test

study_pop.textblock: All patients who have symptoms on COVID-19 and is seen at a hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical suspicion of COVID-19 requiring contact to a hospital.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Age less than 18 years

          -  Previous enrollment in this study.
